page.title: 15WINTERINGHAM METHODISM
page.content: In 1978 a small, modern Methodist Church was built. This replaced a very large chapel built in West End in 1891. Since 1823 there have been two other Methodist chapels opened in the village the most recent in 1978. Serv- ices are held each Sunday morning and evening with an average congregation of 30. About 35 children attend the weekly Sunday School. Each month a family service is held which is atten- ded by other denominations. A large barn behind the church has been reno- vated and is used for parties and functions. Anniversaries are well attended and followed by teas in the barn. Each year a Field Day is held with sports events for children, stalls, teas and fancy dress. Trophies are awarded for the sports. Wintering- ham is part of the Scunthorpe Circuit, a shared ministry of six parishes.
